messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

re notification windows upgrade process how to free up space re notification upgrade process how free up space dear still have enough space only have personal data or work folders please assist thanks job integration taxation specialist sent tuesday october notification upgrade process how free up space hello you already found out our previous announcements rollout upgrade was started one month ago you receiving because your drive you have enough space perform upgrade process minimum requirement free space you advised follow next steps free up some space your drive move your personal data separate personal drive regarding your work files please move them onto your you have space available there you can use app located here tools desktop size your folders files can be helpful tool for you easily identify biggest files folders if you still have available after file move please contact or note if you member or teams please apply upgrade yet you can always get contact with our kind regards ext

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing user request**

I see the user provided some unstructured text regarding a notification about a windows upgrade process and freeing up space. It seems they’re experiencing issues related to storage space on their drive and are asking for assistance. 

I need to categorize this request within a predefined list. Based on the context, it looks like it fits best under the "Storage" category since they’re focused on freeing up space for the upgrade process. That makes sense, right?**Selecting ticket category**

I need to choose the right category for an IT ticket related to a Windows upgrade process and freeing up space. The content mentions moving personal data to a separate drive and using a tool to find large files. It seems like it fits best under the "Storage" category since it's about clearing space for the upgrade. While “Administrative rights” was a consideration, it’s mainly focused on storage cleanup for the upgrade. So, I'll summarize this as a JSON object with "Storage" as the category.{"category":"Storage"}
